no: from karmic to natty?
only from one lts to the next or from one release to the next
xangua: ok I have a friend with karmic, I tried update-manager -d and it shows no updates available, what's the correct procedure then
karmic is no longer supported, best to do a fresh install
ok I already did changed all karmic occurences to natty and did dist-upgrade for him and left the office, now this is serious, how can I proceed?
you did a fresh install of karmic and changed the sources to natty? you should never do that
it's a karmic installation and he did work for some time on it and have critical files. I already did that and thought there would be no problem
now I need some help
get the critical files off the machine, store them somewhere safe and do a fresh install of natty (if you want natty)
ok so if the system didn't boot I would do that, but isn't there any possibility that it would work?
updating like you described will not work because it isn't designed to do that, get a livecd to recover whatever files you need
ok thanks for the tip
np, and please check before doing something major like changing update sources
sure. I remembered I do this to my laptop and upgraded it that way and things went smooth this is why I didn
didn't thought it would cause an issue
but now I understand it should be one level up not more, right?
yes, or from one lts release to another
the update manager should give you the option itself, so there shouldn't be a need to edit the lists yourself
so that editing is an old method which is deprecated now in favor of update-manager, right?
i can't recall it being used officially as an update method
